= Features Reference=

==1.Pad Screen==

	* *Ref 1.1*<br>
	On click a L command must be send to N64. Optionally (depending on configuration) there will be vibration.

	* *Ref 1.2*<br>
	On click a Start command must be send to N64. Optionally (depending on configuration) there will be vibration

	* *Ref 1.3*<br>
	On click a R command must be send to N64. Optionally (depending on configuration) there will be vibration

	* *Ref 1.4*<br>
	On click a Z command must be send to N64. Optionally (depending on configuration) there will be vibration

	* *Ref 1.5*<br>
	On touch a position (based on X and Y Axys) command could  be send to N64 (depending on configuration, enabled/disabled). Optionally (depending on configuration) there will be vibration.

	* *Ref 1.6*<br>
	On click a position command (based on button Axys) could  be send to N64 (depending on configuration, enabled/disabled). Optionally (depending on configuration) there will be vibration.

	* *Ref 1.7*<br>
	On click a A command must be send to N64. Optionally (depending on configuration) there will be vibration

	* *Ref 1.8*<br>
	On click a B command must be send to N64. Optionally (depending on configuration) there will be vibration

	* *Ref 1.9*<br>
	On click a C command (left - right - down - up) must be send to N64. Optionally (depending on configuration) there will be vibration

	* *Ref 1.10*<br>
	On click options screen will be shown


== 2.Options Screen ==

	* *Ref 2.1*<br>
	Enable/Disable vibration.

	* *Ref 2.2*<br>
	Enable/Disable joystick.

	* *Ref 2.3*<br>
	Enable/Disable cross.

	* *Ref 2.4*<br>
	Floating option menu will be shown
	  * Ref 2.4.1
	  A floating option window will show these presets:
	    * Soft
	    * Hard
	    * Medium
